Author: Panic-atthepanic
Text: It's insane.   I kept going from picture to mirror and I still dunt understand how I can't see what everyone else is.  Maybe we just get that wrapped up in our self hate.  I'm glad your friend was supportive though, it's really nice he told you that you look the same because it sounds like you needed someone to remind you of it

Author: punchjackal
Text: It really is incredible. I hung out with my high school sweetheart a few weeks ago and was really embarrassed about how fat I thought I was. I tried my hardest not to talk about it, but he saw right through me. He pulled up a photo of me at 19, what I thought was the "golden age" for my body. Concerned, he says, "I don't know what you're seeing. Because you look the same. You might have a little looser belly skin, but you're shaped the same."  That photo blew me away. I legitimately didn't realize how warped my perception of my body was, always certain that I really was as ugly as I saw myself as.
